title: IndexError happen at a project with identity=true & uniquebodyparts in 2.2rc1

labels.name: backwards compatibility
labels.description: issues concerning prior to current versions

body:
**Describe the bug** In 2.2RC1, when I try to run the training with a multi-animal project `identity=true` and some `uniquebodyparts`, I got an `IndexError`. **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: Windows 10 - DeepLabCut Version: '2.2rc1' - DeepLabCut mode: multi-animal tracking **To Reproduce** 1. make multi-animal project with `identity=true` *AND* having some `uniquebodyparts` in `config.yaml` 2. extract, labeling frames and create training dataset with GUI 3. trying train network, then got error like this:
TRACEBACK

```python Exception in thread Thread-1: Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\threading.py", line 926, in _bootstrap_inner self.run() File "C:\Users\XXX\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\threading.py", line 870, in run self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs) File "C:\Users\XXX\pyenv\dlc_gpu_latest\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\train_multianimal.py", line 76, in load_and_enqueue batch_np = dataset.next_batch() File "C:\Users\XXX\pyenv\dlc_gpu_latest\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\dataset\pose_multianimal_imgaug.py", line 279, in next_batch joint_ids, batch_joints, data_items, sm_size, image_shape File "C:\Users\XXX\pyenv\dlc_gpu_latest\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\dataset\pose_multianimal_imgaug.py", line 222, in get_targetmaps_update joint_ids[i], [joints[i]], data_items[i], sm_size, scale File "C:\Users\XXX\pyenv\dlc_gpu_latest\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\dataset\pose_multianimal_imgaug.py", line 417, in compute_target_part_scoremap_numpy scmap[mask, person_id + num_joints] = 1 IndexError: index 10 is out of bounds for axis 2 with size 10 ```

**Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.** I got this error regardless of NetType; confirmed for ResNet50 and DLCRNet. I thought `person_id + num_joints` is mismatching to `num_joints + num_idchannel` value that of used in scmap's initiation (`pose_multianimal_imgaug.py`). But I'm not too familiar with the new DeepLabCut, so I can't be sure. This RC update looks amazing, and I'm really enjoying it! I would love to try this `identity=true` feature. I would appreciate any advice! Thank you in advance!
